wikipedia_page.main:
Audrey Gillan is a British journalist and screenwriter.
Gillan began reporting for The Guardian in 1998 after seven years with other news organizations. After working in Iraq during the 2003 invasion, she was named Foreign Correspondent of the Year by the What the Papers Say Awards.
Her six-part series documenting the lives of Tara and George, two rough sleepers, won Radio Programme of the Year at the 2019 Broadcasting Press Guild Awards.
